title: Avengers' Tom Holland reveals Chris Hemsworth and Chris Pratt’s secret handshake
text:
Tom Holland unveiled Chris Pratt and Chris Hemsworth’s secret handshake (Picture: Getty / Rex )

Avengers: Endgame stars Chris Hemsworth and Chris Pratt had a secret Chris handshake, and it has made us miss them even more.

But what about Chris Evans?!

Walking spoiler Tom Holland unveiled their little ritual online, in a video with director Joe Russo.

Which kind of means it’s not so secret anymore…

In a clip shared on the official Russo brothers’ Twitter account, the Spider-Man star, 23, pretended he was the Thor actor, donning a paper bag over his head which read: ‘Hemsworth’, while Joe introduced himself as Chris Pratt.

The handshake started out as your ordinary, bog-standard handshake, before they threw in a few circular motions and twirled their fingers towards each other.

We guess the secret Chris handshake isn’t so secret anymore… Check out https://t.co/mK8Zg53JxL to keep up with #AGBOSuperheroLeague. Joe AKA “Chris Pratt” is playing for the @ArthritisFdn and Tom AKA “Chris Hemsworth” is playing for @Tbrotherstrust. @AGBOfilms @TomHolland1996 pic.twitter.com/vpqbdqK2t1 — Russo Brothers (@Russo_Brothers) October 11, 2019

Despite whacking out his best Australian accent, Tom fooled precisely no one.

We’re going to need Chris, Chris and Chris to show us how it’s done…

Fans couldn’t get enough of the clip, with one commenting: ‘Hahaha gotta learn that secret Chris handshake.’

‘These videos are gold. Haha,’ another wrote.

Spider-Man is heading back to MCU (Picture: Columbia)

While a follower acreamed: ‘THE DUO I DIDN’T KNOW I NEEDED!! I LOST IT WHEN TOM HOLLAND STOOD UP ON HIS TOES BWAHSJFGDFSHAAA!!!

‘THANK YOU FOR THIS WHOLE VIDEO Y’ALL!!’

The video comes after it was confirmed Tom would be returning to the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

Superhero fans threatened to boycott when it emerged that Spidey would be leaving the Avengers gang behind, following a dispute between Disney and Sony.

However, after all the uproar, it seems they all managed to work things out, with Marvel president Kevin Feige announcing he would be taking the helm of the third instalment of the Spider-Man Homecoming franchise.

‘I am thrilled that Spidey’s journey in the MCU will continue, and I and all of us at Marvel Studios are very excited that we get to keep working on it,’ he said in a statement.

‘Spider-Man is a powerful icon and hero whose story crosses all ages and audiences around the globe.
